limb noun [C]
(OF PERSON/ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an arm or leg of a person or animal: The accident victims mostly had injuries to their lower limbs (= legs). an artificial limb
More examplesFewer examplesAmputation of the limb is really a last resort.Although she had to have her leg amputated, she still feels as though she's got a phantom limb.He risked life and limb to get the cat down from the tree.If it continues to bleed, you may have to apply a tourniquet to the limb.It is a vestigial limb.
